briefTitle: A Safety and Efficacy Study of a Recombinant Fusion Protein Linking Coagulation Factor IX With Albumin (rIX-FP) in Patients With Hemophilia B
officialTitle: A Phase II/III Open-label, Multicenter, Safety and Efficacy Study of a Recombinant Coagulation Factor IX Albumin Fusion Protein (rIX-FP) in Subjects With Hemophilia B
summary: This study will examine the safety, pharmacokinetics and efficacy of rIX-FP for the control and prevention of bleeding episodes in subjects who have previously received factor replacement therapy for hemophilia B.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change in Frequency of Spontaneous Bleeding Events Between On-demand and Prophylaxis Treatments (Annualized)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Up to 26 weeks for on-demand regimen, and between 1 and 17 months for prophylaxis regimen.
